rawConfiguration.text:
[![here's what we support](https://cloud.hashicorp.com/_next/image?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.datocms-assets.com%2F58478%2F1638210562-logo.svg&w=256&q=75)](https://www.consul.io/)

This dashboard provides visibility into the health of your HCP Consul environment. It relies on data collected by the [HCP Consul integration](https://newrelic.com/instant-observability/hcp-consul/bc99ad15-7aba-450e-8236-6ea667d50cae).


---
The dashboard includes the following tabs:
- **Overview** - key indicators describing the overall health of your environment
- **Client** - Insight into the health of your client membership
- **Network** - Insight into the health of requests moving between your nodes
- **Runtime** - Insight into the health of your node runtimes
- **Serf** - Insight into the health of node discovery and orchestration
- **Envoy** - Insight into the performance of the Envoy proxy

nrqlQueries.query: FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(consul.source.datacenter) where consul.source.datacenter is not null facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
SELECT round(min(consul.system.licenseExpiration)) as 'Hours' FROM Metric facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
SELECT count(consul.api.http.summary) from Metric facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 25
SELECT average(consul.kvs.apply) from Metric facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 25
SELECT average(consul.txn.apply) from Metric facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 25
SELECT sum(consul.serf.member.flap) as 'Node flaps' from Metric facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 25
SELECT sum(consul.client.rpc) as 'RPC Requests' FROM Metric SINCE 5 minutes ago where metricName = 'consul.client.rpc' TIMESERIES facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
SELECT sum(consul.client.rpc.exceeded) as 'RPC Exceeded' FROM Metric since 5 minutes ago facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 25
SELECT sum(consul.client.rpc.failed) as 'RPC Failed' FROM Metric since 5 minutes ago facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 25
FROM Metric SELECT rate(sum(consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns.mean)/1000000, 1 minute) as 'Avg GC Pause (ms)' where metricName like 'consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns.mean' since 5 minute ago

FROM Metric SELECT rate(sum(consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns.mean)/1000000, 1 minute) as 'Avg GC Pause (ms)' where metricName like 'consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns.mean' since 5 minute ago TIMESERIES facet consul.source.datacenter limit 25
SELECT rate(latest(consul.runtime.sys_bytes), 1 minute) from Metric since 5 minute ago TIMESERIES facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
SELECT rate(latest(consul.runtime.alloc_bytes), 1 minute) from Metric since 5 minute ago TIMESERIES 1 minute facet consul.source.datacenter
FROM Metric SELECT latest(envoy.cluster_manager.active_clusters) where consul.source.datacenter is not null SINCE 30 minutes ago facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT clamp_min(sum(envoy.cluster.membership_total)-sum(envoy.cluster.membership_healthy), 0) SINCE 30 minutes ago FACET consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT average(envoy.server.memory_allocated)/average(envoy.server.memory_heap_size) * 100 SINCE 30 minutes ago facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT sum(envoy.http.rq_total) SINCE 30 minutes ago FACET consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 25

rawConfiguration.text:
## HCP Consul: Client Health

The dashboard focuses on the health of your HCP Client members, including:
- API HTTP calls
- Txn/KVS
- Nodes and Messages
- Consul Cache 

The charts in this dashboard show the **top 50** Client instances for each metric. To view more Client instances, you can change the query by selecting "Edit Query" in the chart's action menu.

Please check the [official documentation](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/telemetry) for a full listing of Consul Telemetry. (Note: HCP Consul does not emit Server telemetry, including Raft telemetry.)
 
In Query Builder, run a query like the following to see the full list of metrics available in your data:

```FROM Metric SELECT * WHERE metricName like '%consul%' LIMIT MAX```

nrqlQueries.query: FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(consul.source.datacenter) where consul.source.datacenter is not null facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(statsdSource) as 'Client' where consul.source.datacenter is not null and metricName not like 'envoy%' facet statsdSource limit MAX
SELECT count(consul.api.http.summary) from Metric TIMESERIES LIMIT 50 facet statsdSource, path, method
SELECT average(consul.api.http.summary) from Metric facet statsdSource, path, method TIMESERIES limit 50
SELECT average(consul.txn.apply) from Metric facet statsdSource TIMESERIES limit 50
SELECT average(consul.kvs.apply) from Metric facet statsdSource TIMESERIES limit 50
SELECT sum(consul.serf.member.flap) as 'Node flaps' from Metric facet statsdSource TIMESERIES limit 50
SELECT sum(consul.memberlist.health.score) as 'Health Score' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.memberlist.health.score' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource limit 50
SELECT average(consul.memberlist.probeNode.summary) as 'Avg Probe Duration (ms)' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.memberlist.probeNode.summary' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource limit 50
SELECT average(consul.memberlist.gossip.summary) as 'Duration (ms)' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.memberlist.gossip.summary' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource limit 50
SELECT count(consul.memberlist.msg.alive) from Metric where metricName = 'consul.memberlist.msg.alive' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource limit 50
SELECT count(consul.memberlist.msg.dead) as 'Dead' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.memberlist.msg.dead' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.memberlist.msg.suspect) from Metric where metricName = 'consul.memberlist.msg.suspect' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.consul.cache.fetch_error) as 'Fetch Errors' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.consul.cache.fetch_error' FACET statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT sum(consul.consul.cache.fetch_success.per_second) as 'Fetch Successes' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.consul.cache.fetch_success.per_second' FACET statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.consul.cache.entries_count) as 'Cache Entries' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.consul.cache.entries_count' FACET statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50

rawConfiguration.text:
## HCP Consul: Network

This dashboard focuses on indicators regarding HCP Consul network health, including statistics on:
- RPC
- TCP
- UDP
- gRCP

The charts in this dashboard show the **top 50** Client instances for each metric. To view more Client instances, you can change the query by selecting "Edit Query" in the chart's action menu.

Please check the [official documentation](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/telemetry) for a full listing of Consul Telemetry. (Note: HCP Consul does not emit Server telemetry, including Raft telemetry.)
 
In Query Builder, run a query like the following to see the full list of metrics available in your data:

```FROM Metric SELECT * WHERE metricName like '%consul%' LIMIT MAX```

nrqlQueries.query: FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(consul.source.datacenter) where consul.source.datacenter is not null facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(statsdSource) as 'Client' where consul.source.datacenter is not null and metricName not like 'envoy%' facet statsdSource LIMIT MAX
SELECT sum(consul.client.rpc) as 'RPC Requests' FROM Metric where metricName = 'consul.client.rpc' FACET statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT sum(consul.client.rpc.exceeded) as 'RPC Exceeded' FROM Metric FACET statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT sum(consul.client.rpc.failed) as 'RPC Failed' FROM Metric FACET statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.memberlist.tcp.connect) as 'Connects' from Metric where metricName IN ('consul.memberlist.tcp.connect') facet statsdSource TIMESERIES limit 50
SELECT count(consul.memberlist.tcp.accept) as 'Accepts' from Metric where metricName IN ('consul.memberlist.tcp.accept') facet statsdSource limit 50 timeseries
SELECT average(consul.memberlist.tcp.sent) as 'Bytes Sent' from Metric where metricName IN ('consul.memberlist.tcp.sent') TIMESERIES facet statsdSource limit 50
SELECT average(consul.memberlist.udp.sent) from Metric where metricName = 'consul.memberlist.udp.sent' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
SELECT average(consul.memberlist.udp.received) from Metric where metricName = 'consul.memberlist.udp.received' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.grpc.client.connections) as 'gRPC Connections' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.grpc.client.connections' FACET statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT sum(consul.grpc.client.request.count) as 'gRPC Requests' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.grpc.client.request.count' FACET statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50

rawConfiguration.text:
## HCP Consul: Runtime

This dashboard focues on statistics indicative of runtime health:
- garbage collection
- heap size and allocation
- Go routines

The charts in this dashboard show the **top 50** Client instances for each metric. To view more Client instances, you can change the query by selecting "Edit Query" in the chart's action menu.

Please check the [official documentation](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/telemetry) for a full listing of Consul Telemetry. (Note: HCP Consul does not emit Server telemetry, including Raft telemetry.)
 
In Query Builder, run a query like the following to see the full list of metrics available in your data:

```FROM Metric SELECT * WHERE metricName like '%consul%' LIMIT MAX```

nrqlQueries.query: FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(consul.source.datacenter) where consul.source.datacenter is not null facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(statsdSource) as 'Client' where consul.source.datacenter is not null and metricName not like 'envoy%' facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
FROM Metric SELECT rate(sum(consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns.mean)/1000000, 1 minute) as 'Avg GC Pause (ms)' where metricName like 'consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns.mean' since 5 minutes ago

FROM Metric SELECT rate(sum(consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns.mean)/1000000, 1 minute) as 'Avg GC Pause (ms)' where metricName like 'consul.runtime.gc_pause_ns.mean' TIMESERIES 1 minute facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
FROM Metric SELECT latest(consul.runtime.total_gc_runs) as 'GC Runs' where metricName like 'consul.runtime.total_gc_runs' since 5 minutes ago facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
SELECT latest(consul.runtime.heap_objects) as 'Heap Objects' from Metric since 5 minutes ago facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
SELECT latest(consul.runtime.heap_objects) as 'Heap Objects' from Metric TIMESERIES facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
SELECT rate(latest(consul.runtime.sys_bytes)/1000000, 1 minute)-rate(latest(consul.runtime.alloc_bytes)/1000000, 1 minute) from Metric TIMESERIES 1 minute facet statsdSource limit 50
SELECT average(consul.runtime.num_goroutines)  as 'Go Routines' from Metric WHERE metricName = 'consul.runtime.num_goroutines' TIMESERIES facet statsdSource limit 50
SELECT sum(consul.runtime.malloc_count)  as 'Malloc Count' from Metric WHERE metricName = 'consul.runtime.malloc_count'  facet statsdSource LIMIT 50
SELECT sum(consul.runtime.free_count)  as 'Free Count' from Metric WHERE metricName = 'consul.runtime.free_count' facet statsdSource LIMIT 50

rawConfiguration.text:
## HCP Consul: Serf

Consul uses Serf to manage cluster membership and message broadcasting. This dashboard highlights some key statistics regarding Serf performance within your HCP Consul environment - however, please note that Serf telemetry is principally generated by Consul Servers, rather than Clients. You will principally see Serf telemetry during the intial communication of the Client agent with the Server.

The charts in this dashboard show the **top 50** Client instances for each metric. To view more Client instances, you can change the query by selecting "Edit Query" in the chart's action menu.

Please check the [official documentation](https://www.consul.io/docs/agent/telemetry) for a full listing of Consul Telemetry. (Note: HCP Consul does not emit Server telemetry, including Raft telemetry.)
 
In Query Builder, run a query like the following to see the full list of metrics available in your data:

```FROM Metric SELECT * WHERE metricName like 'consul.serf%' LIMIT MAX```

nrqlQueries.query: FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(consul.source.datacenter) where consul.source.datacenter is not null facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT uniqueCount(statsdSource) as 'Client' where consul.source.datacenter is not null and metricName not like 'envoy%' facet statsdSource LIMIT MAX
SELECT count(`consul.serf.events.consul_new-leader`)  as 'New Leaders' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.serf.events.consul_new-leader' facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.serf.queue.Event.summary)  as 'Events' from Metric facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.serf.queue.Query.summary) as 'Queries' from Metric facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT average(consul.serf.snapshot.appendLine.summary) as 'Time to Append (ms)' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.serf.snapshot.appendLine.summary' facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.serf.msgs.sent.summary) as 'Sent' from Metric where metricName = 'consul.serf.msgs.sent.summary' facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50

SELECT count(consul.serf.msgs.received.summary) as 'Received' from Metric where metricName IN ('consul.serf.msgs.received.summary', 'consul.serf.msgs.sent.summary') facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.serf.member.joined)  as 'Joined' from Metric facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.serf.member.left)  as 'Left' from Metric facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50
SELECT count(consul.serf.member.failed)  as 'Failed' from Metric facet statsdSource TIMESERIES LIMIT 50

rawConfiguration.text:
## Envoy

HCP Consul leverages Envoy proxy server for network abstraction and traffic routing. This dashboard relies on data collected by the [HCP Consul Envoy integration](https://newrelic.com/instant-observability/hcp-envoy/64da4a3b-bfc9-4c18-9d98-55e250c955bd) and highlights key indicators for Envoy, focusing on:
- Envoy server health
- cluster membership health
- network traffic performance

Please check the [official documentation](https://www.envoyproxy.io/docs/envoy/latest/configuration/configuration) for more information regarding Envoy Telemetry.
 
In Query Builder, run a query like the following to see the full list of metrics available in your data:

```FROM Metric SELECT * WHERE metricName like 'envoy%' LIMIT MAX```

nrqlQueries.query: FROM Metric SELECT latest(envoy.cluster_manager.active_clusters) where consul.source.datacenter is not null facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT latest(envoy.cluster_manager.warming_clusters) where consul.source.datacenter is not null facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT sum(envoy.http.rq_total) FACET consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 25
FROM Metric SELECT latest(envoy.server.live) facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT average(envoy.server.memory_allocated)/average(envoy.server.memory_heap_size) * 100 facet consul.source.datacenter LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT average(envoy.server.memory_allocated)/average(envoy.server.memory_heap_size) * 100 facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT latest(envoy.server.uptime)/3600 facet consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT round(rate(sum(envoy.cluster.membership_total), 15 seconds)) FACET consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT clamp_min(sum(envoy.cluster.membership_total)-sum(envoy.cluster.membership_healthy), 0) FACET consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT round(rate(sum(envoy.cluster.membership_degraded), 15 seconds)) FACET consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES LIMIT 25
FROM Metric SELECT round(average(envoy.cluster.upstream_cx_active)) FACET envoy.cluster_name, consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 50
FROM Metric SELECT sum(envoy.cluster.upstream_rq_total) FACET envoy.cluster_name, consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 50
FROM Metric SELECT sum(envoy.cluster.upstream_cx_rx_bytes_total) FACET envoy.cluster_name, consul.source.datacenter TIMESERIES limit 50
FROM Metric SELECT round(average(envoy.listener.downstream_cx_total)) FACET consul.source.datacenter, envoy.listener_address TIMESERIES limit 50
FROM Metric SELECT average(envoy.listener.downstream_cx_length_ms.per_second) FACET consul.source.datacenter, envoy.listener_address TIMESERIES limit 50
